values.description:
I noticed a race condition in some of my overnight testing. It usually occurs with `UNIT_gz_TEST` and gives the following console output:

~~~
341: [----------] 9 tests from gzTest
341: [ RUN      ] gzTest.Alive
341: [       OK ] gzTest.Alive (1094 ms)
341: [ RUN      ] gzTest.Joint
341: AL lib: (WW) alc_initconfig: Failed to initialize backend "pulse"
341: [Msg] Waiting for master.
341: [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
341: [Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.93
341: [       OK ] gzTest.Joint (3913 ms)
341: [ RUN      ] gzTest.Model
341: AL lib: (WW) alc_initconfig: Failed to initialize backend "pulse"
341: gzserver: /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:648:
 typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const
 [with T = gazebo::transport::Connection; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type
 = gazebo::transport::Connection*]: Assertion `px != 0' failed.
~~~

The `gzserver` instance started by that test generates a coredump with a backtrace containing the following:

~~~
Core was generated by `gzserver test/worlds/simple_'.
Program terminated with signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
#0  0x00007f3509c33428 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:54
[Current thread is 1 (Thread 0x7f34d410e700 (LWP 14322))]
#0  0x00007f3509c33428 in __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:54
#1  0x00007f3509c3502a in __GI_abort () at abort.c:89
#2  0x00007f3509c2bbd7 in __assert_fail_base (fmt=<optimized out>, assertion=assertion@entry=0x7f350b501395 "px != 0", file=file@entry=0x7f350b501bc8 "/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp", line=line@entry=648, function=function@entry=0x7f350b505040 <boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::transport::Connection>::operator->() const::__PRETTY_FUNCTION__> "typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Connection; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transpor"...) at assert.c:92
#3  0x00007f3509c2bc82 in __GI___assert_fail (assertion=assertion@entry=0x7f350b501395 "px != 0", file=file@entry=0x7f350b501bc8 "/usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp", line=line@entry=648, function=function@entry=0x7f350b505040 <boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::transport::Connection>::operator->() const::__PRETTY_FUNCTION__> "typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type boost::shared_ptr<T>::operator->() const [with T = gazebo::transport::Connection; typename boost::detail::sp_member_access<T>::type = gazebo::transpor"...) at assert.c:101
#4  0x00007f350b4f5903 in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::transport::Connection>::operator-> (this=<optimized out>) at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:648
#5  0x00007f350b4f904f in boost::shared_ptr<gazebo::transport::Connection>::operator-> (this=<optimized out>) at gazebo/Master.cc:339
#6  gazebo::Master::ProcessMessage (this=this@entry=0xdd8860, _connectionIndex=3, _data=...) at gazebo/Master.cc:196
#7  0x00007f350b4f980f in gazebo::Master::RunOnce (this=0xdd8860) at gazebo/Master.cc:409
#8  0x00007f350b4f99a8 in gazebo::Master::Run (this=0xdd8860) at gazebo/Master.cc:387
#9  0x00007f350a296c80 in ?? () from /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6
#10 0x00007f35097026ba in start_thread (arg=0x7f34d410e700) at pthread_create.c:333
#11 0x00007f3509d0541d in clone () at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/x86_64/clone.S:109
~~~

I believe this happens when a connection is deleted between the two map index calls into `this->dataPtr->connections` in the if statement. My proposed workaround is to move the shared pointer local variable first so it will keep the memory consistent.

It's a race condition, so it can be hard to reproduce this error to confirm this fix, but I think the code change makes sense.

Update: I've added fixes for some compiler warnings on bionic in 1e0702a and a fix for `Publisher::OnPublishComplete` that moves the logic into the try block so it will be protected by the mutex (see [discussion](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3014/wip-address-gzserver-shutdown-speed/diff#comment-100189015) on pull request #3014).

values.title: Run Kinematic AnchoredLoop test with dantzig solver, since it now works in dart 6.8

summary.html:
@iche033 noticed in pull request 3086 that one of the kinematic loop tests didn't work with the Dantzig LCP solver. This was reported upstream and partially fixed in dart 6.8, so I've enabled the test case that now works for the Dantzig solver. I did this by adding an extra TEST_F case when dart 6.8+ is available.

I also changed DARTPhysics::SetSolverType to return without updating the internal sdf data if the solver type is unknown, so that the expectation that the solver type matches what we tried to set it to is more meaningful.

  • DARTPhysics::SetSolverType: return without updating sdf if solver type is unknown

  • Run AnchoredLoop test with dantzig solver, since it now works in dart 6.8

#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3086/fix-2605-kinematic-loops-for-dart-67-and/diff#comment-96097536

values.description:
Dartsim 6.9.0 was recently released and merged into homebrew-core, which broke our bottles for gazebo9 and gazebo10.

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64&build=1311)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/1311/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-install-one_liner-homebrew-amd64/1311/

While rebuilding the bottles, I noticed a build failure for gazebo10:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra&build=369)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra/369/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra/369/

~~~
In file included from /tmp/gazebo10-20190528-97377-khdxwp/gazebo-10.1.0/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTHeightmapShape.cc:20:
In file included from /tmp/gazebo10-20190528-97377-khdxwp/gazebo-10.1.0/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTCollision.hh:23:
In file included from /tmp/gazebo10-20190528-97377-khdxwp/gazebo-10.1.0/gazebo/physics/dart/dart_inc.h:24:
In file included from /usr/local/include/dart/dart.hpp:33:
In file included from /usr/local/include/dart/config.hpp:5:
In file included from /usr/local/include/eigen3/Eigen/Core:441:
/usr/local/include/eigen3/Eigen/src/Core/AssignEvaluator.h:834:3: error: static_assert failed due to requirement 'Eigen::internal::has_ReturnType<ScalarBinaryOpTraits<typename ActualDstTypeCleaned::Scalar, typename Matrix<double, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1>::Scalar, assign_op<float, double> > >::value' "YOU_MIXED_DIFFERENT_NUMERIC_TYPES__YOU_NEED_TO_USE_THE_CAST_METHOD_OF_MATRIXBASE_TO_CAST_NUMERIC_TYPES_EXPLICITLY"
  EIGEN_CHECK_BINARY_COMPATIBILIY(Func,typename ActualDstTypeCleaned::Scalar,typename Src::Scalar);
  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/usr/local/include/eigen3/Eigen/src/Core/util/XprHelper.h:816:3: note: expanded from macro 'EIGEN_CHECK_BINARY_COMPATIBILIY'
  EIGEN_STATIC_ASSERT((Eigen::internal::has_ReturnType<ScalarBinaryOpTraits<LHS, RHS,BINOP> >::value), \
  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
/usr/local/include/eigen3/Eigen/src/Core/util/StaticAssert.h:33:40: note: expanded from macro 'EIGEN_STATIC_ASSERT'
    #define EIGEN_STATIC_ASSERT(X,MSG) static_assert(X,#MSG);
                                       ^             ~
/usr/local/include/eigen3/Eigen/src/Core/PlainObjectBase.h:732:17: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'Eigen::internal::call_assignment_no_alias<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1>, Eigen::Matrix<double, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1>, Eigen::internal::assign_op<float, double> >' requested here
      internal::call_assignment_no_alias(this->derived(), other.derived(), internal::assign_op<Scalar,typename OtherDerived::Scalar>());
                ^
/usr/local/include/eigen3/Eigen/src/Core/PlainObjectBase.h:537:7: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'Eigen::PlainObjectBase<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1> >::_set_noalias<Eigen::Matrix<double, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1> >' requested here
      _set_noalias(other);
      ^
/usr/local/include/eigen3/Eigen/src/Core/Matrix.h:377:9: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'Eigen::PlainObjectBase<Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1> >::PlainObjectBase<Eigen::Matrix<double, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1> >' requested here
      : Base(other.derived())
        ^
/tmp/gazebo10-20190528-97377-khdxwp/gazebo-10.1.0/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTHeightmapShape.cc:67:36: note: in instantiation of function template specialization 'Eigen::Matrix<float, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1>::Matrix<Eigen::Matrix<double, 3, 1, 0, 3, 1> >' requested here
  this->dataPtr->Shape()->setScale(Eigen::Vector3d(this->scale.X(),
                                   ^
1 error generated.
~~~

Something in dart 6.9 (the switch to c++14?) has triggered this Eigen compilation error, based on the use of 32-bit `float` as the type for Heightmap heights:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/src/7c2936c66a23e6c6707fe4c7790458e75824407e/gazebo/physics/HeightmapShape.hh#lines-48

This should be enough to fix it.

values.description:
SVGLoader.cc lacks handling of v,V,h,H commands according to \[1\]. E.g., Inkscape produces path descriptions using these lineto commands, which are therefore not importable by any Gazebo. However, since SVGLoader.cc hasn’t changed since gazebo7, this PR applies to many versions which might benefit from this feature.

\[1\] [https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathDataLinetoCommands](https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#PathDataLinetoCommands)
values.title: Extend SVG parsing: Add missing lineto commands v,V,h,H

The debian [QA checker complained](https://lintian.debian.org/tags/pkg-config-references-unknown-shared-library.html) about gazebo exporting libraries in pkg-config which are not provided by the package referencing to boost libs.

If I understand the understand correctly we should move boost libs to Libs.private to avoid overlinking of shared libraries. With the change, the QA is happy again.

summary.html:

values.description:
This merge was a little tricky because some camera intrinsics work from pull request #2058 was backported to gazebo9 in pull request #3099 with some changes. Per this [prior discussion](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3099/backport-camera-intrinsics-feature/diff#comment-103358103):

gazebo10 has protected members:

    Camera::cameraProjectiveMatrix
    Camera::cameraUsingIntrinsics

while gazebo9 has

    CameraPrivate::cameraProjectionMatrix (note change from Projective -> Projection)
    CameraPrivate::cameraUsingIntrinsics

Following the suggestion from @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} in that comment thread, I've done the following:

* changed the code to use the protected members
* removed the private members added in pull request #3099
* added the `Camera::BuildProjectionMatrix` function alongside `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix`
* changed `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix` to call `Camera::BuildProjectionMatrix` internally
* added a doxygen `\deprecated` tag to `Camera::BuildProjectiveMatrix`, though we won't officially deprecate it until the `default` branch

Checking CI and awaiting review of the conflict merging from @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5}.

values.description:
I am not sure if this is a gazebo or OGRE bug. gazebo crashes when loading collada files with multiple geometries and some of the geometries does not have skins associated with it.

This happens because gazebo loads the whole collada model as a single mesh, with the geometries as each submesh. This creates a situation where the mesh can have a skeletion associated with it but some of its submesh has no blend weights and OGRE throws an error regarding missing blend weights.

This PR works around this by creating a dummy node assignment so that it passes the OGRE check.
values.title: fix crash when loading submesh with no bone assignments

values.description:
Since  CMake 3.14 \(in  particular due to this MR: [https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/merge\_requests/2677](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/merge_requests/2677)\) the `FindCURL.cmake` CMake script uses `pkg-config`-related function, that apparently when  used  reset the `PKG_CONFIG_FOUND` to `False` if `pkg-config`is not found in the system. 

To restore the original `MSVC`-related workaround, we move the call to `find_package(CURL)` before the logic related to hardcoding `PKG_CONFIG_FOUND` to `True` on `MSVC`.

‌
values.title: Fix CMake 3.14 regression in MSVC/PKG_CONFIG_FOUND workaround

summary.raw:
Since  CMake 3.14 \(in  particular due to this MR: [https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/merge\_requests/2677](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/merge_requests/2677)\) the `FindCURL.cmake` CMake script uses `pkg-config`-related function, that apparently when  used  reset the `PKG_CONFIG_FOUND` to `False` if `pkg-config`is not found in the system. 

To restore the original `MSVC`-related workaround, we move the call to `find_package(CURL)` before the logic related to hardcoding `PKG_CONFIG_FOUND` to `True` on `MSVC`.

‌
summary.html:
Since CMake 3.14 (in particular due to this MR: https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/merge_requests/2677) the FindCURL.cmake CMake script uses pkg-config-related function, that apparently when used reset the PKG_CONFIG_FOUND to False if pkg-configis not found in the system.

To restore the original MSVC-related workaround, we move the call to find_package(CURL) before the logic related to hardcoding PKG_CONFIG_FOUND to True on MSVC.

‌

values.description:
Back in  [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2692](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2692), I added this part of  CMake code to find OGRE in systems without pkg-config. However, back in time I probably tested these changes with a modified OGRE, as  there are some problems in the current version that  prevent to configure Gazebo successfully with OGRE if `pkg-config` is not available. This PR fixes this problems. 

In particular, the fixed problems are: 

* There is a nasty bug in CMake \(see [https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/17135](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/17135)\) that  prevents to successfully run a `find_package(<package>)` call if before there was a failed call to `pkg_check_modules(<package> <package>)` . You  can find the details in [https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/17135#note\_626879](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/17135#note_626879) , but a workaround is to manually unset the `OGRE_FOUND` cache variable.
* The `OGRE_PLUGINDIR` is used  in the main Gazebo CMakeLists.txt \(see [#!/osrf/gazebo/src/7c4281fe1229236496a0532515d596dbb4c86e70/CMakeLists.txt#lines-164](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/7c4281fe1229236496a0532515d596dbb4c86e70/CMakeLists.txt#lines-164)\), but OGRE’s just exports `OGRE_PLUGIN_DIR` . To  be  compatible with the `pkg-config` related code, we just assign to `OGRE_PLUGINDIR` the value  of `OGRE_PLUGIN_DIR` . 

‌

Downstream related PR: [https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/8178](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/pull/8178) .

‌
values.title: Fixes for finding OGRE with CMake config files

values.description:
This PR adds support for frame semantics as implemented in [SDFormat PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1). It doesn't add first class support for frames, instead, it resolves poses into frames Gazebo currently expects, i.e., poses relative to parent xml elements in most cases.


## Requirements:
* ~~libsdformat7 [PR 560](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/560?w=1)~~
* libsdformat9 PRs [PR 640](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/640) and [PR 647](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/647)

## TODO:
* ~~Add support for joint axis `expressed_in` attribute.~~
* ~~Add frame semantics for model editor ~~
* ~~Check if saved sdf files preserve frame semantics. This could be by simply storing the transformed poses as opposed to keeping `frames` and `relative_to`s intact. ~~

cc: @{557057:f3a199b9-5784-4964-9644-6ef224bc7dc1}

values.description: This fixes some cmake warnings and issue #2664. As of cmake 3.11, cache strings can't have multiple lines. We are apparently caching the string used to hold the list of headers for each auto-generated header file, but that string shouldn't need to be cached. This uses a simple `set` command instead of the `APPEND_TO_CACHED_STRING` macro from `cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake` and fixes the warnings.
values.title: Don't use cmake cache for auto-generated header strings

We are apparently caching the string used to hold the list of headers for each auto-generated header file, but that string shouldn't need to be cached. This uses a simple `set` command instead of the `APPEND_TO_CACHED_STRING` macro from `cmake/GazeboUtils.cmake` and fixes the warnings.

values.description:
The next major version of gazebo (11) will use the versions of ignition dependencies corresponding to ignition citadel. These dependencies require c++17 and cmake 3.10. These dependencies are available in Ubuntu Bionic, but not xenial. The planned list of these versions is in the following pull requests:

* #!/osrf/gazebodistro/pull-requests/49/gazebo11yaml-using-ignition-citadel/diff
* #!/osrf/gazebodistro/pull-requests/48/add-the-citadel-gazebodistro-file/diff

There is a significant API change required: ignition-math6 renamed the `ignition::math::Box` class to `ignition::math::AxisAlignedBox`, so this type is changed in any API's that used `ignition::math::Box` in 39d46a2. There are also some API changes to `ignition::math::Inertial` (see 46356e6), but that doesn't affect gazebo's API.

There's also a significant behavior change in ~~ignition-msgs4~~ ignition-msgs5, which now uses the proto3 syntax, which doesn't allow optional fields. So I've removed all checks for optional fields in fda2ce1. This commit should be reviewed carefully.

~~ignition-fuel-tools3~~ ignition-fuel-tools4 is now a required dependency instead of an optional dependency.

This requires ~~sdformat8 8.4.0~~ sdformat9 9.0.0 (currently a prerelease). The windows build requires the following gazebodistro PR:

* #!/osrf/gazebodistro/pull-requests/49/gazebo11yaml-using-ignition-citadel/diff
values.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

values.description:
[#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2666/simpletrackedvehicleplugin-multiple](#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2666/simpletrackedvehicleplugin-multiple)

If multiple vehicles using the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin plugin are created, they interfere with each other because each instance of the plugin considers all track bodies \(not just those of the plugin instance’s model\) as tracks of the model.

I believe this is due to a lack of checking if the bodies of the contact joints that are used to move the vehicle are actually the tracks of this vehicle. The plugin does use category bits but uses the same category bits for all instances of the plugin.

I have added code to explicitly check if the bodies are tracks and this is working for my use case.
values.title: SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin: checked if body is one of the tracks before applying force to it to prevent multiple instances of this plugin interfering with each other.

#!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2666/simpletrackedvehicleplugin-multiple

If multiple vehicles using the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin plugin are created, they interfere with each other because each instance of the plugin considers all track bodies (not just those of the plugin instance’s model) as tracks of the model.

I believe this is due to a lack of checking if the bodies of the contact joints that are used to move the vehicle are actually the tracks of this vehicle. The plugin does use category bits but uses the same category bits for all instances of the plugin.

I have added code to explicitly check if the bodies are tracks and this is working for my use case.

values.description:
The default branch currently has 179 gcc warnings and 84 codecheck complaints on Ubuntu bionic:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-nvidia&build=1)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-nvidia/1/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/GazeboDefault/job/gazebo-ci-default-bionic-amd64-gpu-nvidia/1/

This branch reduces that to 16 warnings and 63 codecheck complaints:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-nvidia&build=13)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-nvidia/13/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-nvidia/13/

The changes are organized by commit:

* remove unmatched cppcheck suppressions

* Mapshape.hh: use `%u` for unsigned ints in printf

* MainWindow_TEST: use iterator on only one data structure

* fix dangling-else compiler warnings

* use `[[fallthrough]]` attribute to silence implicit-fallthrough warnings

* increase some array sizes in ColladaExporter to fix format-truncation warnings (copied from ign-common3)

* msgs/GazeboGenerator: suppress unused-parameter warnings (copied from ign-msgs)

* DARTPhysics: add missing assignment operator to LinkPair class

* JointWrench: use rule of 0, remove unneeded assignment operator

This is targeting pull request #3139 with some extra changes required by the update to sdformat8, which stopped using `boost::any`. Since we are now using c++17, it seemed easiest to just convert osrf/gazebo to use `std::any` instead of `boost::any` as well.

values.description:
This is an alternative to pull request #3146 that creates a templated static helper function `PhysicsEngine::any_cast` that attempts to cast a `boost::any` to `std::any`, since `PresetManager` is inadvertently embedding `std::any` values from libsdformat8 inside `boost::any` and passing them to `PhysicsEngine::SetParam`. I've updated all `boost::any_cast` calls in the derived `SetParam` functions to use the `any_cast` helper and also make sure to catch `std::bad_any_cast` exceptions.

This should be much lower impact on downstream users than pull request #3146.
values.title: [gazebo11] Add helper function PhysicsEngine::any_cast to handle std::any

values.description:
Added support for flippers in the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin.

I’ve right away made it ABI-compatible with gazebo9 \(I needed to change the type of one of the member variables\). Now I really regret I haven’t PIMPLized even the “leaf” plugin classes, but just the TrackedVehiclePlugin common ancestor. The reviewers should be more strict about PIMPLizing new stuff :smiley:

The PR is structured so that if you cherry-pick everything except commits [91c6858](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/91c68584e02e75f1347a3b59872eaf9ce7eee7b9) and [d34bd4a](https://bitbucket.org/peci1/gazebo/commits/d34bd4a28dbbf7a9bb6fa97aa60f8b88b8b914e1?at=gazebo9), you get the nicer version without the ugly ABI-compatibility global variable.

The PR added options to mark links as either left/right flipper, which means these links will behave as if they were the main tracks in contact with terrain. Any kind of articulation of the flippers is left to the user using the standard joint controller mechanisms.

Added support for flippers in the SimpleTrackedVehiclePlugin.

I’ve right away made it ABI-compatible with gazebo9 (I needed to change the type of one of the member variables). Now I really regret I haven’t PIMPLized even the “leaf” plugin classes, but just the TrackedVehiclePlugin common ancestor. The reviewers should be more strict about PIMPLizing new stuff

The PR is structured so that if you cherry-pick everything except commits 91c6858 and d34bd4a, you get the nicer version without the ugly ABI-compatibility global variable.

The PR added options to mark links as either left/right flipper, which means these links will behave as if they were the main tracks in contact with terrain. Any kind of articulation of the flippers is left to the user using the standard joint controller mechanisms.

As per https://github.com/OGRECave/ogre/blob/master/Docs/1.11-Notes.md, the FreeImage codec got moved to a separate plugin in OGRE 1.11

This plugin needs to be loaded for texture support.
